input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.span: Byron-Bergen will be closed to students beginning Monday, March 16 until further notice. This closing includes all school-related activities including sports and other extracurricular activities.

div.a: 5th and 6th graders 3-D print PPE with a positive spin

span.span: If a health care worker puts on a face shield inscribed with the words “Heroes wear scrubs, not capes,” it might have been designed by a Byron-Bergen fifth or sixth grade student. STEAM Lab Teacher Craig Schroth recently dropped off 100 face shields designed and donated by students to Face Shields ROC, an organization collecting face shields to distribute to medical facilities and first responders in the Rochester area.

img.title: Schroth
img.alt: 5th and 6th graders 3-D print PPE with a positive spin

span.span: Governor Cuomo announced on April 16 that all schools in New York State will remain closed until May 15.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Dear Jr./Sr. High School Students and Families:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman"; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: I wanted to start by thanking everyone for their collaboration and support of one another over the past month. I know moving to the pacing guides last week and an online learning platform is new to a lot of us. We are evaluating this on bi-weekly basis to provide a continuity of education for our students.

div.a: Monday Message from Superintendent Edwards - April 13, 2020

br.span: It is a strange time as I look out over the Byron-Bergen campuses and see no kids playing, no sports teams practicing, and no staff out walking on the track. As much as I look forward to a time when the fields will bustle with activity again, for everyone’s safety, the playgrounds, sports fields, and school buildings remain closed.

img.title: school crest
img.alt: Monday Message from Superintendent Edwards - April 13, 2020

div.a: Monday Message from Superintendent Edwards - April 6, 2020

span.p: As our time apart continues, I know it has been hard on many of you. I, too, am feeling the separation from family and friends. But, I can’t help but be a little excited by the innovation and creativity this separation has brought to our educational community.

img.title: Edwards
img.alt: Monday Message from Superintendent Edwards - April 6, 2020
